snippet: The game had been linked to the World Series for the past 14 years, as the winning All-Star team secured home-field advantage for its league, but that fact never gave the game the desired ratings lift....
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column assesses reported changes to Major League Baseball as part of first new collective bargaining agreement under Rob Manfred as league commissioner; singles out uncoupling of World Series home-field advantage from results of All-Star Game as particularly worthy change, as decision to link two was questionable from start.
lead_paragraph: The game had been linked to the World Series for the past 14 years, as the winning All-Star team secured home-field advantage for its league, but that fact never gave the game the desired ratings lift.

headline.print_headline: Restoring a Game to What It Should Be
headline.main: Baseball Labor Deal Turns All-Star Game Back Into an Exhibition
